website_summaries.verdict: For wine drinkers who want a clear indication of when the bottle is sufficiently sealed.
pros: Keeps wine fresh for about a week
Rubber stoppers are made well and should last
Easy to operate the pump and remove the stoppers
Emits a click to tell you when you need to stop pumping
Bottle stoppers fit many types of bottles
cons: According to some customers, it takes quite a few pumps to get a good seal

customer_reviews.title: Not genuine Vacu Vin
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and received a cheap Chinese knockoff. No box, it just came in a clear plastic bag (not going to make a pretty gift). And it says Made In China, even though the description clearly says made in the Netherlands.
customer_reviews.author: james sissler

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not work...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a few times since I bought it about 6 weeks ago and never have gotten the "click." I've had my husband try, I've pumped 40 or so times and still nothing. I get a weak seal at best with wine that tastes off the following day. I figured maybe I had gotten a dud, but after reading several recent reviews it seems that the issue is more common than I thought. I'm glad I only spent $8 or so, but disappointed in the poor product I received. Nowhere on the pump or corks does it say Vacuvin which makes me wonder if this is some type of cheap knock off.
customer_reviews.author: Lora C

customer_reviews.title: ... while to get the hang of this but I love it now
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to get the hang of this but I love it now!! Wet the outer-edge of the stopper, place the stopper inside your wine bottle, then begin to pump. Once you hear it do a "click, click" noise, you have vacuumed the air out. To release the stopper (letting air back in), just press the center piece of the stopper to one side.
customer_reviews.author: Terrill M.

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had to send this back because it arrived in pretty gross condition. First, the outside of the box and the product inside were covered in a layer of dust, which in the grand scheme of things isn't a huge deal. However, the ends of the plugs and inside of the pump were dirty, like they had been used before. There was gunk stuck in the crevices and inside the pump, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Katie J.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap knockoff
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap knockoff product. The box does not show the Vacu Vin label anywhere.The function is not nearly as good as described.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. from PNW

customer_reviews.title: Loses its seal
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think it works at all- seems like it loses the seal on its own. I make sure I hear the little vacuum sound, too.....still ends up not working- wine goes bad after 2 days. I don’t drink more than 1-2 cups, and I don’t WANT to be forced to drink it daily until it’s gone, and all the good stuff is in regular sized bottles....just tired of it going to waste. Wished this would have worked better.
customer_reviews.author: KawaiiKeishii

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for a couple who love wine more than I do (nearly impossible) after having ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a couple who love wine more than I do (nearly impossible) after having mine for a couple years, then I bought it again for another friend when she and her hubs bought a house! I will keep buying this as long as there are people who don't have it. Great gift, totally practical, and I have no worries that it's going to hold up for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: D. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Bottle Stopper - for all kinds
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased other bottle stoppers in the past. But they usually will only work for a few hours. Someone recommended these vacuum stoppers, because they said that the suction creates a tighter seal. And we LOVE them. Not only do we use the for different wine bottles, I also use them for my craft 22 oz bottles of beer. I once half of it, and put the stopper in because I thought I was going to drink the rest a little later. I completely forgot. The next day, when I saw the bottle, I was dreading that I was going to have a flat beer. But it wasn't! It was still effervescent and tasted great!
customer_reviews.author: El Juegador

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product a few months ago and didn’t it use it right away because it had so many good reviews, I wish I would have returned it. I tried it in different kinds of wine bottles and DOES NOT WORK. After pumping for several minutes it is not tight and does not pop as the reviews said. Would not recommend it, don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: jesus melendez

customer_reviews.title: " You're probably correct (and we would probably be good friends). But this can do so much more
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of people think, "why would I ever open a bottle of wine and not finish it?" You're probably correct (and we would probably be good friends). But this can do so much more. If your friends come over and pop some Prosecco, the Vacu Vin can keep that thing bubbly until the end of the night. It also works with hard alcohols should you lose the cap (in drunken confusion). I highly recommend having one of these on hand. Even for that rare occasion that your friends accidentally open two bottles of wine at once!
customer_reviews.author: Thad Phallinger

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to its name
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on a recommendation from a local vineyard and boy are we pleased! I've heard of more expensive products ($150-200) but never one for $20 that actually works. If you ever host dinners or have friends over, open a few bottles of wine, and on the rare occasion there ends up being some left over, this definitely helps in slowing down the oxidation process to give you an extra few days to enjoy the wine. You can definitely taste the difference. On the flip side, an even cheaper solution would be never to have any left over wine :) This would make a great gift or stocking stuffer too!
customer_reviews.author: Freebird

customer_reviews.title: The Best Gadget ever!
customer_reviews.text: Now I can enjoy that "just opened the bottle" flavor for several days! Easy and convenient to use, well worth the price. Solid construction....should last a while. I love this thing. **UPDATE: after using this for several months, the plunger started sounding noisy. Easily fixed... Just pull the plunger all the way up and apply a very tiny amount of vaseline to the inside surface of the housing, and then slide the plunger up and down. It is now smooth and quiet again!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff from Sunny Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift for any wine lover, easy and effective (I found a bottle of Chardonnay in bottom of fridge, had been there for month..... it was still good). Best /safest if bottle is standing up when using the Vacu. If you lay the bottle down, make sure not to hit the Vacu, as it will release the pressure = leaks. Do not buy from the seller I used a few weeks back (March 2019), if you want to use it as a gift... it came in an envelope, though padded, the Vacu box was smashed up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to work. I can't get this thing to work. I've watched videos and I can't hear a click. It leaks a little if the bottle is on its side and doesn't keep the wine fresh or sealed any longer than if I just put the cork back in.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa K. Cortes

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The box came completely damaged. You could tell it had been previously used and returned. But I'm still giving 4 stars because the product itself works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully to save leftover wine
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for the past 9 years since I bought it back in 2010 and I can't recommend it enough. It preserves leftover wines remarkably and I sometimes wish I have more than the 2 stoppers it came with. The instruction says to pump until you hear a click but I do 3 clicks out of habit and it's still working like the day I got it. Sometimes it shocks me to drink leftover red wine well over a week and it hadn't vulgarized. I wouldn’t be without it and will buy another if I lose it or it ever stops working.
customer_reviews.author: RescueMa

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this at first but gave it a try. I make my own wine and don’t use any additives for preservation. When I open a bottle I usually have to either finish it, or be prepared for a less impressive day two or three. I used this wine vac and tested the same opened bottle every day. The homemade stayed fresh for 5 days with a half filled (or less) bottle! Very happy I purchased this and I will def be purchasing these as gifts for holidays or occasions!
customer_reviews.author: K Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not finishing a bottle of wine is a thing?
customer_reviews.text: Trust and believe, if you drink wine, invest in one of these. It will pay for itself in no time in the amount you usave not pouring leftover wine down the sink. Full disclosure, I rarely have leftover wine, but this works wonders when I do! I have been giving this as a gift to all my wine loving friends and they rave about it. You pump until you hear the click and you’re all set!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle warren

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, does the job, even retains carbonation well
customer_reviews.text: these wine stoppers are so easy to use! i’m also surprised that i haven’t lost either of the two i bought yet. they do a great job of saving my wines. for sparkling wines don’t expect to keep all of your carbonation, although it does a decent job of doing so. i had a sparkling rosé that retained substantial, more than half (if i could somehow quantify) the sparkle even a week later, so it definitely works better than nothing to that end.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: A complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product was packaged very well and arrived in excellent condition. But, other than that it is a complete waste of money. I have used it countless times and no matter what I do I just get an arm workout. It does not work, at all. There are other products of this kind out there that actually do work. But not this one. Do not waste your money or your time. I do not in any way and would never recommend this product to anyone. I gave it one star to be able to post this review.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Works but same
customer_reviews.text: Works without error, but to be honest, I don't really notice a difference in length of time that it savors my wine? My red started to get that vinegar taste in the same amount of time that it would with the cork. I used it correctly and heard the pops, perhaps I am still using it wrong? Unsure how it is supposed to actually make wine last longer, or is that not the goal of this thing?
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Could not get a decent seal. Tried it on multiple bottles of wine but it never worked well. Regular rubber stoppers work better.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This product does a good job of keeping a bottle of wine fresh for a few days. I’m by myself, so it takes me about 3 to 4 days to drink a full bottle of wine. It’s good from the time I open it until I finish it. I don’t know about it being leakproof. The instructions tell you not to place the bottle on its side.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Schnellenberger

customer_reviews.title: Save your favorite wine
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is worse than facing whether to finish the bottle of your favorite wine or throw the last glass or two out because it won't last after the bottle has been uncorked. Issue solved!! Recommended to us by someone who really knows wines and deals in that field. I have ordered 4 total Vacu Vine Wine Savers for friends and family. They are as pleased as we are. No more wasted wine...
customer_reviews.author: Tacy Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Hit or Miss
customer_reviews.text: These have been hit or miss for me. I'm not sure if this is accurate, but it seems that the one I used on my white cooking wine and left in the fridge kept its seal for a couple weeks, while the seal I made for my red wine that I left out would lose its seal after a day. I feel that I'm using it correctly, since I heard the clicks, but for some reason it sometimes doesn't work. I still use it since I feel that it helps at the least marginally, which makes a difference for a few days more of enjoying my red wine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know what I was doing at first so I watched a clip on YouTube and after that it was easy. You put the cork in the bottom as firm as you can place the other piece directly over the stopper and keep pumping until you hear some clicks. When you’re ready to redrink you just till the stopper to the side to let the air out and your good to go. Still taste fresh as when you first bought it.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love it! After I put it on and took the air out, it doesn’t spill at all even when I tilt the bottle. The device is so easy to use. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DannieW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wine Saver!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of all the good reviews and I love it! It is so easy to use. Put the rubber cork on the wine and pump it about 4 times until you hear the clicking and it is done. I have left wine bottles with this for a week and you can still hear the air rushing in when you open. It works well and is definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this gadget! It works well and does keep wine fresh. I'm more an every now drinker and I don't typically finish a bottle in a week so this definitely helps my wine stay fresh over time. This also a great gift as i have given it as a present to several people and they also love it. I highly recommend it! If sealed correctly it doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Memorable Gift for any occasion
customer_reviews.text: Have easily purchased 100 of them for friends and staff. Makes it practical to have a glass of wine without the bottle going bad or temptation to drink too much. Worth buying a bunch to have on hand should the day return we can visit friends or hand out stocking stuffers.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Might Not Work
customer_reviews.text: The one I received never "clicked" at the point of pressurization. I went far and beyond to confirm this. I watched a YouTube vid from 2012 or so just to make sure I wasn't crazy. My product was not as advertised, and I sent it back. Upon reflection I wondered if we need this and ordered the Rabbit stoppers. They work fine. If you are not a wine connoisseur, it may be a waste of your money.
customer_reviews.author: Powdernut 75

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, extends my enjoyment
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Works as explained. You must push down on it while pumping to create suction and the less liquid in the bottle, the more you'll need to pump. The "pop pop" of the seal is unmistakable. I recommend buying an extra pack of the stoppers as they're small and get lost easily in kitchen drawers. I'm the only one drinking wine and very casually, so this is helpful to have it not waste.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Effective Air Seal, Keep Wine Fresh
customer_reviews.text: I got this to keep my wine fresh longer and it works as expected. It comes with 2 stoppers that easily fit into the bottom of the pump. After just a few pulls of the plastic handle, it sucks air out of the bottle and creates a vacuum seal. I'm glad I don't need to try to shove the old cork back into the bottle opening anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Abben H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use wine saver
customer_reviews.text: I do enjoy wine but do not drink it as often as others. Therefore, being able to preserve the contents of the bottle after enjoying one glass is wonderful ... and it saves money by not having to toss the wine so quickly. The wine saver is easy to use by pulling the plunger up to form the vacuum. Just wait til you hear the click and you're done! The stoppers are easy to remove when you're ready for the next glass.
customer_reviews.author: D. Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift for Your Family’s Wine Snob
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum corker to preserve a $150 bottle for a wine loving friend’s visit. He was impressed with the wine’s flavor after vacuum preserving and wine frig care for 3-4 weeks. Don’t ask me if the bouquet, etc. was well preserved, I only drink inexpensive freshly bottled local (Oregon/Washington) wines.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: I used to work in sales for the largest liquor wholesale company in the world. These came out many years ago and are still my choice of product. I try the all -- but this is the best. And most cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: SweetSue

customer_reviews.title: Great but only extends life of wine bottle by 3 - 4 more days
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this product because it was advertised as extending the life of my wine to a week. I like the product and it is easy to use but it only extends the life of my wine to 3 days and sometimes 4. Still a great product but I wanted to give other people a heads up on what to realistically expect.
customer_reviews.author: K K

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: I’m still not sure whether this actually works ..or maybe I’m experiencing user error? I find it difficult to remove the suction device from the stopper once I hear the click meaning it is sealed. I’ve stored several wine bottles using this system, but the taste always seems off when I pour another glass several days later.
customer_reviews.author: Maura Wade

customer_reviews.title: 3 -4 day wine saver! Unexpected surprise
customer_reviews.text: I don’t drink much wine, which is the reason I purchased this to begin with. Normally when I opened a small bottle-being only me drinking it-it would flatten and need to be trashed 2nd day. With this stopper...amazing!!! Seals like new. I had no idea it could be this easy and cost so little! Can enjoy my 1-2 glasses tonight and the same for at least 3 days. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Asta & Radomir’s Mom

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works!
customer_reviews.text: A few people has mentioned using this for horizontal storage. The instructions say to keep it upright. Therefore, this is really designed for a non-chilled wine which you plan on finishing in the near future. It's a quick way to seal up whatever you don't finish for the night. Great gift for your wine enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy, simple, and takes the stress out of not finishing a wine
customer_reviews.text: I never owned anything like this before and wasn't sure if it would work. So far I have been pleased. The unit is compact and with 2 short pumps I usually hear the "click" that lets me know it is working. Just as easy to release. Just push the center nub sideways and it releases when you are ready to drink the remaining wine.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Yates

customer_reviews.title: (Updated) Was: mine never clicks either
customer_reviews.text: Update: I contacted Vacu Vin and they sent me a new one that does click. 5 stars for customer service. Previous review: It has prevented my wine from turning sour, so it seems it does its job so far. But like other reviewers, my pump never clicks either. It does say "Vacu Vin" on the pump and came in a Vacu Vin box with other Vacu Vin promotional materials, so it doesn't seem that it is a knock off.
customer_reviews.author: blue-noise

customer_reviews.title: Good product but some stoppers leak
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set and the rubber stoppers don't fit as well. My old ones would make a popping sound once all the air is pumped out, but no matter how long I pump this one nothing happens. I've given up waiting for the pop and assume their is some leakage,
customer_reviews.author: E,Rappy

customer_reviews.title: A great product.
customer_reviews.text: I have previously owned a different type of device that can be used to pull a vacuum but then the entire device stays on the bottle. I had three or four of them and they all failed after one to two years of use. This product is much simpler and only the stopper remains with the bottle. You can order additional stoppers allowing several bottles to be stoppered at once. The wine remains good for at least a few days or weeks. It is very good product and I will certainly recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel P McManus

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not as stated and quality is not up to the mark of other vacu vin products I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done but product does not work as stated, low quality materials especially on the tops/plugs. It does vacuum seal open wine bottles reasonably well, but there is no ‘click’ or any sound at all while pumping - no matter how much you do it. Seems to be related to the fact that the tops/plugs are visibly of very low quality. Ive had a chance to compare them to original vacu vin grey colored stoppers, and these are clearly different and inferior: all black, made of shoddy materials (the top is unsealing and the sides are fraying).
customer_reviews.author: MrMeister

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for every wine drinker
customer_reviews.text: Other Notes: - Plain and Simple... this works and you should buy one now - At this price point, it is a no-brainer Pros: - Excellent value - Simple to use, pump until you hear the clicking noise, release by pushing the top valve - My wine went from spoiling in a few days, to lasting weeks (yes, I'm a VERY occasional wine drinker... so this works perfect for me) - I have had no issues with suction loss (even after a couple weeks) Cons - None
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Don't settle for off brands. Settle for this.
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical as I bought the Rabbit version of this and it was garbage... This however gets the job done every time. My organic, non sulfite wine which is very hard to keep after opening was great 3 days later. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: SB Roozenboom, Author

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: Why haven’t I had one of these before? I’m amazed that it kept a bottle of wine fresh and perfect for a couple days on my counter, super easy to use, would buy this again and would make a great gift for anyone that drinks wine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: This product keeps your red wine good for about a week and is also nice to use on white wine to ensure freshness. I'm so happy I bought it! I like to have a glass of wine or two in the evenings, but I rarely finish a bottle of red within the time it takes the wine to go bad (which I find is 3-4 days). With this, my red wine lasts about a week and a half!
customer_reviews.author: LindsayRoseEliz

customer_reviews.title: Extend your wine's open shelflife!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, really works to protect open wine from oxidation. No more feeling its a waste if you don't finish the bottle! Easy to use, well presented, and extra stoppers easily obtained. Highly recommend for wine drinkers if by some slim chance you don't have one already!
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These stoppers definitely worked as advertised. My wine tasted perfect when I re-opened the bottle 5 days later. They are very easy to use - just wait for the click and your bottle is sealed. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: writerdame

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a great wine stop
customer_reviews.text: I am now able to buy better quality wines and not feel compelled to drink the whole bottle or drink stale wine. I opened a bottle before I went on a two week trip and when I came back the wine was still fresh. It works wonderfully well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: YES... have a glass or two and it keeps till the next time. Even a couple months has been fine. (not that many people wait that long to finish a bottle but you never know!!! )
customer_reviews.author: LVGal

customer_reviews.title: Bought an imitation one with more stoppers
customer_reviews.text: Big mistake. The pulley on the imitation one came off right away. The product is no longer in existent. Ordered this one and so much sturdier. The clicking to indicate that all the air is out works too! Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Wrigley Guy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lets you know when you've removed enough air, and stays sealed, can't ask for much more!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, it's not complicated so there isn't much to say, you put the stopper in the bottle, press the pump on top of it and pump till it starts clicking. When you want the wine again you just press on the top and it releases easily. I've had a couple other types of these before and it was either hard to know when you had enough air out, or they leaked. So while it sounds simple the fact that it lets you know when you've removed enough air and that it stays sealed is a big plus
customer_reviews.author: ToddTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I drank about a glass of wine a note to keep the cold away and it was a pain taking the cork on and off this thing is incredibly easy to use and keeps a strong seal. (I pulled on it fairly hard to test) it's easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: bradley

customer_reviews.title: We've tried different brands. The other brands leak if ...
customer_reviews.text: We've tried different brands. The other brands leak if the wine bottle is on its side. This one doesn't leak and the wine is still fresh for several days (wine in my house doesn't last for more than a few days AT MOST...so I cannot attest to the wine staying fresh for a week or more). If you are storing wine after its been open for more than a few days, then wine may just NOT be for you.
customer_reviews.author: C Bass

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the wine drinker
customer_reviews.text: Perfect item for the wine lover in your life. This is a must have item to keep your wine fresh if you do not finish after opening. It is the perfect add on when giving someone a bottle of wine or gift yourself if you do not have one
customer_reviews.author: 3r

customer_reviews.title: How did I ever live without this
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. Works like a charm. Wish I had known about this before. So easy to use and never have to try to shove a cork back in the bottle. A few pumps until you hear the click click sound and it's air tight again.
customer_reviews.author: Social worker

customer_reviews.title: PUMP IT UP!
customer_reviews.text: Must buy for all you wine lovers out there. Its basically a pump to get all the air out of a wine bottle so it stays fresh longer. Just put the stopper on the opening of the bottle, pump till you hear a click and thats it. It's perfect for those nights you just want to have a glass of wine or 2 after work but can't finish the whole bottle. I highly recommend this if you find yourself in the aforementioned scenario on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: eight1178

customer_reviews.title: Handy vacuum saver for wine
customer_reviews.text: While it takes a little getting used to, I like being able to vacuum seal wines, as we often do not finish the bottles right away. There are only two corks with this set, so if you tend to have more than two bottles open at a time, you will need to order extra corks. It is quite simple to use--place the cork in the bottle, then pump the handle until the cork gives a light "click." Done!
customer_reviews.author: -=Rudy=-Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: You know your wine is sealed when you hear the click.
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use! You can buy extra seals, toppers. You know your bottle is sealed when you hear the click. If you have one of the large bottles and drink it down, it'll take a few more pumps, but you'll be able to lay the bottle on it's side in the fridge and not worry your wine will spill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Very innovative and effective. I used it once and unit created a great vacuum in the bottle. 1 week later when I removed the top from the bottle I head the air rushing in, I knew it had a great vacuum and the red wine tasted pretty good. IMPORTANT: Make sure you follow instructions exactly to prevent damage to your pump.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item for those rare times you don't drink the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for those rare times you don't drink the entire bottle of wine in one sitting while you lament all of your poor life choices. If you want to save that Boone's Farm or Ripple for later then it can be just as fresh as when it was bottled last Tuesday. You can even save fancy wines with this and get a satisfying pop sound when you pull out the stopper. You get that feeling of splurging on the $15 bottle of wine multiple times. It's great if you can just make the wine last.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Now I have to buy wine to cook with because my unfinished bottles last forever.
customer_reviews.text: Before I got this awesome little device I would open a bottle of wine, have a glass or two, and do whatever I could to seal it. Nine times out of ten I would use the rest of the bottle to cook with because it was no longer drinkable. Now though, now I have to have specific bottles just for cooking which means I'm drinking more. Not a complaint but thought you should know if you're considering getting this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amandapants

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for wine drinkers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for preserving your unfinished bottles of wine! By pumping out the air and effectively resealing the bottle, you can keep your wine tasting good for significantly longer than simple re-corking would. Prior to purchasing this item, I found myself consistently pouring out wine that had turned after just a day or two. Now, I have drank wine that has been opened for nearly an entire week without much change in the flavor. I highly recommend this product to any wine drinker!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Seems to do the job
customer_reviews.text: I'm not the nuttiest wine nut, but it seems to keep a bottle fresher than without, especially if you've only poured a glass or two. I immediately cork it after pouring to minimize airflow. Also, its easier than trying to re-use the cork. My only complaint is that it starts 'clicking' to say you have enough vacuum WAY before I can actually feel a drag on the plunger. Partial pressure of oxygen and all that... the less air you have in the bottle, the less oxygen is available to oxidize the wine...
customer_reviews.author: Aradona

customer_reviews.title: I'm hopeful this is the answer!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it clicks when the suction is done. I've tried other brands (rabbit) and they did not hold suction for very long. I noticed other family members and bars use this kind. I look forward to non-vinegared wine the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy preservation of a half-bottle of wine.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to keep two bottles of wine fresh. You insert the provided stopper (two included), place the pump on top, and pump until you hear a click. To remove the stopper, you press sidewise to release the vacuum, and the stopper comes out easily. You can pour a glass, replace the stopper, and pump the bottle down again.
customer_reviews.author: Don Bishop

customer_reviews.title: If you love wine, this is a must . . .
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for wine lovers. Air kills opened wine. This device sucks the air out of an opened un-corked bottle of wine. I have been using these for years. Now they have redesigned the stoppers so they click at the optimal pressure. Don't let your wine get ruined by time & air. Get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Z

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, holds vacuum. Only issue is when the bottle is half full or less there is a lot of air to pump out, takes 40-50 pumps.
customer_reviews.author: DECKARD

customer_reviews.title: Effective and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent at prolonging the life of an open bottle (when the bottle actually lasts longer than a day). Pump has been working great for quite a while now and the rubber quality on the plugs is great, no smells or signs of dry rotting. Now if they could only solve the disappearing issue of the plugs....
customer_reviews.author: Philip Moore

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is amazing and so simple to use. It truly keeps your wine fresh for several days after opening it (probably longer, but I've never made it that far!). I can now open a bottle of wine, have a glass, and not worry about it going bad until I'm ready to have another glass in a few days. I was very skeptical after trying many wine savers over the years, and this is by far the best one. To use, just place the plastic "cork" into the bottle opening, use the pump until it clicks, then store in the fridge!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product many times over now, and it has always preserved the wine for several days. It is simple enough to use. Just pump until you hear the click, then stop. I have recommended this product to friends who are also slow to finish a bottle of wine or overestimated what people would want to drink at a party.
customer_reviews.author: S. Norton

customer_reviews.title: Even a bottle of Boone's Farm would deserve better than this
customer_reviews.text: The item sent was not the item ordered. We expected the "T" shape, but instead got this odd loop that doesn't perform properly, and the suction is laughable. Even a bottle of Boone's Farm would deserve better than this. Shame we didn't realize it till it was too late to return them, as we missed the return date by 1 day. So disappointing when businesses change what was once a well made and functioning product just for the sake of changing something.
customer_reviews.author: l'etoile MV

customer_reviews.title: A Big Money And Wine Saver
customer_reviews.text: It really seams to keep the wine fresh longer. My wife and I enjoy a glass of wine every now and then and we wasted quite a lot of wine over the years. For the small amount of money this cost I have already saved that much or more in wine. We usually never finish a whole bottle and then put it to the side for a couple of days before having another glass. We used to use regular wine stoppers or the old cork and in a few days the wine turns and becomes undrinkable. Now the wine can seems to last a week or so and is still good.
customer_reviews.author: KKORN

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this product!!
customer_reviews.text: It normally takes me a few days to finish a bottle of wine because I don’t drink every day and I live by myself. This product has saved my wine!! The wine tastes fresh even several days after I opened the bottle. I tried another stopper that was supposed to get the air out, but it was terrible. This is a great product!! It’s easy to use and keeps wine fresh.
customer_reviews.author: slsmpsn

customer_reviews.title: Perry useless for champagne
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much useless. You have to pump many many time to get the "click" sound, and even then the cork slips out almost immediately. Definitely not a solid seal. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bellewithab

customer_reviews.title: A new mom's dream
customer_reviews.text: I stinking LOVE this thing and tell everyone I can about it! As a new mom, I'm limited to not drinking an entire bottle of wine in one sitting like I would like to do (kidding...sort of) at the end of a long day. This wine saver makes every glass taste like the bottle was just opened which is of course fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wine not!
customer_reviews.text: Gave these as Christmas presents to my good friends and sister in law. I also own one. They are GREAT!! Comes with two tops. I've since purchased more. If you drink wine and don't finish the bottle in one setting this is for you!! My husband and I argue over who gets to use it. Fun putting on and taking off.
customer_reviews.author: CoAnn

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Fourth wine vac I have bought and this one works the best. Keeps a seal for weeks although I wouldn’t recommend leaving wine that long after opening but the wine tasted pretty good even after weeks after opening with this vac. Only comes with two plugs so I would pick up a few extra for just in case lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny

customer_reviews.title: It’s better with this than leaving your opened bottle of wine without it
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if it’s leak proof since I don’t turn bottle upside down. As for freshness, my bottle of wine last 2 days at most, so for the two days it’s doing it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working as promised
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I store the bottle upright so I dont have issue with leakage. I really like that it starts to click when you are done and the air is all out. I purchased other systems were you keep pumping and you can’t tell
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Williams Jr.

customer_reviews.title: However when I got it I was very impressed at how easy it was to use
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. I was nervous about getting this particular one because it looked as if it wouldn't work very well. However when I got it I was very impressed at how easy it was to use! The noise it makes when it is done is just a single click while pumping. I wish it was a tad bit louder though. The plugs are easy to work with. When you want to open them, you just push the tab in the center in any direction, you'll here air moving through it and it's done. I would highly recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift last year and added to my gift list this year. I LOVE this product! Unfortunately now I do not have a good reason to drink the entire bottle :P
customer_reviews.author: meagan freeman

customer_reviews.title: Good design, perhaps not industrial strength....
customer_reviews.text: This is fundamentally a good idea. The thing does work. It does create a vacuum within your half-empty wine bottle. But, I do kind of get the sense that it's only a partial vacuum. After a couple of days, it seems that air will slowly leak back through the rubber cork, oxidizing the wine. It does extend the shelf life of the wine by a few days (especially in the refrigerator), but not much longer than that. I'd like to have one of these that had a more industrial, commercial-kitchen feeling to it, which created a really hard vacuum within my wine bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Lash LaRue

customer_reviews.title: Barely even a gimmick. Possibly worse than a solid piece of rubber.
customer_reviews.text: This is a stupid product. A 5 year old child can pull a better vacuum with a straw than this can. With a wine bottle half full, you can pump all day and it doesn't click. And even when it does, it means nothing because it leaks like a screen door. I tested it on my finger tip and could feel the vacuum disappear in seconds. Read the reviews about how it preserves wine for a few more days than an open bottle, and realize any wine stopper will do that.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Nilsen

customer_reviews.title: Vacu-works!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to figure out, easy to use, fresh wine for months on end!! You’ll never need another wine bottle! Oh wait, it doesn’t make wine, it just keeps what you haven’t finished fresh. I bought it as a gift for wine connoisseurs and they like it. Doubt they’re “just being nice.”
customer_reviews.author: BillTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love it! since I am the only one drinking ...
customer_reviews.text: had this MANY years ago, and some how forgot about it with changes in life. came across on deal page. absolutely love it! since I am the only one drinking at home, and I normally only have a glass with dinner (not even every night), helps extend the life of the wine.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Santoro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just what was needed for any left over wine it keeps it tasing delicious the next time! (Why left over wine? ha ha)
customer_reviews.author: Deborah G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the slow wine drinker
customer_reviews.text: The caps for the bottles fit snug and are easy to get in and out. My favorite feature of this product is the noticeable click that the pump make when you have pumped sufficient air out of the bottle. You can even push the nozzle on the top of the caps to open the valve and allow the pressure to equalize. Otherwise it would be a little tough to yank them out when you are ready for that next glass. If you want to keep your wine fresh then this is an easy solution that gets a lot of comments from jealous guests.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump 2 years ago. In my house there is always a daily bottle to seal. So that said I would estimate that this pump sealed at least 750 bottles. I also use it to seal other bottles with a neck size equivalent to a wine bottle. The last 10-15 bottles I have tried to seal have been difficult as the pump seems to be "grinding" and not pumping smoothly. I tried washing/cleaning but to no avail. I have ordered the exact same one again. At about $0.016 per bottle sealed I feel it is still a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Roger A. Fox

customer_reviews.title: keeps wine fresh as new.
customer_reviews.text: a very nice item to have in case you don't finish the whole bottle it will taste like you just open up a new bottle.
customer_reviews.author: woody

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use & works
customer_reviews.text: As billed. Bought one for my son, as I had one for a year. Really does keep wine fresh for a few more days. Easily worth $12
customer_reviews.author: Devhog

customer_reviews.title: Good for keeping wine fresh
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this vacuum set for over six months now. Usually after I open a bottle of wine the wine is exquisitely consumed within two days. My girlfriend, a sommelier, recommended this vacuum set. I'm impressed with how fresh the wine is the following day! Also, I have given a set out as a Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Having downed a bottle or two in my life, I've always been flummoxed as to how to store the wine afterwards. I'm quite picky and the taste of "blown" wine is disgusting. This is the solution. The stoppers fit perfectly (naturally) and the vacuum pump is also perfect. Just pump until you hear the click and the job is done. Easy to release the pressure and re-enjoy the wine (instead of using it to cook or merely turn your sink a pretty crimson colour) For the cost of wine, the minor expense of this pump and stopper system will pay for itself immediately. In vino veritas!!!
customer_reviews.author: erik

customer_reviews.title: This device sucks the air out and preserves wine well
customer_reviews.text: This device sucks the air out and preserves wine well, but it does not prevent the wine from leaking out of the bottle. You must still store the bottle upright. You must also ensure that the tip does not bend or press against something or it will not seal in the air. I have a small refrigerator, and accidentally bent the tip as it touched the shelf above it. Too much air got into the bottle and my wine was not good the next day.
customer_reviews.author: AngelZie

customer_reviews.title: I have two similar pumps in my other homes and the stoppers all have multiple ridges and work great. Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The wine stoppers only have one ridge and do not hold a seal on any bottle I opened. I have two similar pumps in my other homes and the stoppers all have multiple ridges and work great. Design flaw. The pump is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: keeps my wine fresh for days
customer_reviews.text: This usually extends an open bottle of wine for 3-4 days (not that it takes me that long to finish most bottles ;) Easily pulls a vacuum on the bottle to reduce the amount of oxygen exposed to the wine. Can put the bottle back in the fridge or on the counter and the wine stays fresh for days. At the end of the 3-4th day, the wine tastes like it has been open for 12hrs, so it allows some "breathing" but doesn't allow it to overly oxidize giving you bad flavors. I actually prefer the wine on the second day, because it is like allowing the wine to breath fully.
customer_reviews.author: mille35

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the girls of the house who do not finish a bottle when opened. It work as stated with little effort. They seem to enjoy the wines when reopened to finish. Would recommend to those who only have a glass or two per occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Vacu Vin Wine Saver Pump with 2 x Vacuum Bottle Stoppers - Black (Black with 2 wine stoppers)
product_meta.description: The Original Vacu Vin Wine Saver was the first of many patented Vacu Vin inventions and the first of its kind on the market. Vacu Vin’ has revolutionized the wine preservation process. It is now used in over 35 million households and more than 80 countries throughout the world.
feature_bullets: Remove air from your wine bottle to keep wine tasting new for up to a week!
Contains 1 Black Wine Saver Vacuum Pump and 2 Grey Vacuum Bottle Stoppers.
Suitable for all Red and White Wines.
Just insert the universal wine stopper into the bottle and pump until you hear the patented "Click". The "Click" signals an air tight seal!
Packaging may vary - but always look for the original Vacu Vin logo to be sure you are purchasing authentic product. 2 different packaging of the products are shown in the images.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars6,706 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
